concise_definition: adj. 抑郁的, 引起抑郁的; n. 抑郁症患者

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to or characterized by depression, especially a persistent low mood, loss of interest, and feelings of hopelessness or worthlessness.
definitions.explanation_cn: 与抑郁相关或具有抑郁特征的，通常表现为持续的情绪低落、兴趣丧失以及无助或无价值感。
definitions.example_en: She has been experiencing depressive symptoms for several months.
definitions.example_cn: 她已经持续数月出现抑郁症状。

definitions.explanation_en: Causing or tending to cause depression; having a gloomy or discouraging effect.
definitions.explanation_cn: 引起或倾向于引起抑郁的；具有阴郁或令人沮丧的影响。
definitions.example_en: The depressive atmosphere of the abandoned building made everyone uneasy.
definitions.example_cn: 那座废弃建筑阴郁的氛围让每个人都感到不安。

definitions.explanation_en: A person who suffers from depression; often used informally or in clinical contexts to refer to someone with depressive disorder.
definitions.explanation_cn: 患有抑郁症的人；常用于非正式或临床语境中指患有抑郁障碍者。
definitions.example_en: He was labeled a depressive by his peers, though he never sought professional help.
definitions.example_cn: 他的同伴称他为抑郁症患者，但他从未寻求专业帮助。

comparison.analysis: “Depressed” 是形容词，强调当前的情绪状态，指某人正处于抑郁情绪中，通常是暂时性的；而 “depressive” 更侧重于描述一种性质、特征或障碍，常用于医学语境中指抑郁症的类型或倾向，如 “depressive disorder”。
“Melancholic” 指一种忧郁、沉思、诗意的悲伤情绪，常带有审美或性格色彩，不一定达到临床抑郁的程度；而 “depressive” 更具医学和病理含义，明确指向抑郁症的临床表现，情感强度和功能损害更严重。
“Dysphoric” 描述一种广泛的情绪不适状态，包括烦躁、焦虑、不满或情绪低落，但不必然包含抑郁的核心症状如无价值感或自杀念头；而 “depressive” 特指符合抑郁症诊断标准的综合症状群，范围更窄、更专业。
